positive.review:
GTA V Online is pure chaos and freedom.
Endless heists, ridiculous stunts, and trolling friends never get old.
9/10 ‚Äì perfect for losing hours without noticing

This game still has a chat system.
Is it fun? Hell no, unless you're a masochist for cheaters.
But at least there's still a chat system so you can voice your rage.

GTA 5 is one of my favorite games. I‚Äôm a real fan of the whole series, and I still regularly play GTA Online. What surprises me is that even though the game is old, it still feels ‚Äúalive‚Äù: the city moves, the missions don‚Äôt get boring, and there‚Äôs always something to do online. I often plan to hop in for a few minutes, and suddenly half the evening is gone. It‚Äôs just one of those games that keeps its charm for years and doesn‚Äôt fall apart over time. And the best part is that even though I know it inside out, it can still surprise me sometimes.

And yeah, I‚Äôm really waiting for GTA 6. I know it won‚Äôt come to PC right away, but I‚Äôll still wait for my turn. And even when the sixth game finally releases, I‚Äôll still come back from time to time to cruise around Los Santos ‚Äî the game just has its own kind of comfort.

Great driving game. But no matter the content/mission it was not designed for combat. Game seizes between scenes and often locks up. Here i give a thumbs up. But if it was a 5 star rating i would only give it a 3-star. Its a fun game. Be prepared to work for your money ....don't beg!! There is plenty of ways to make cash. There will be plenty of "greifers" playing to annoy you to tears. Don't carry cash so they don't get a bonus for killing you. Auto insurance is free so don't get bent out of shape when they blow you up. Dust yourself off and move on! Go to the casino every day to spin the wheel for goodies, cash and RP. 8/10

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

I‚Äôve been playing GTA V since the day it dropped. I‚Äôm 22 now, which means this game has been a part of my life for around 12 years ‚Äî basically half my lifetime.

Across multiple accounts, consoles, and PCs, I‚Äôve put in roughly 5000 hours, with 1200+ hours on this account alone. And somehow, even after all that time, GTA still feels like coming home.

Los Santos was the first open world that truly felt alive to me. I grew up with this game ‚Äî from staying up late doing missions I was way too young for, to jumping into GTA Online with friends, to returning years later and finding that spark all over again.

It‚Äôs not just a game at this point. It‚Äôs nostalgia, chaos, comfort, and memories all mixed together.

10/10 ‚Äî Thank you, GTA V, for growing up with me.

Other than that this game is fun asf and I am excited for the new GTA 6 to come out as well.

GTA V Review (From a 16-Year-Old Gamer)

GTA V is honestly one of the best games I‚Äôve ever played. Even though it came out years ago, it still feels fresh every time I open it. The map is massive, the graphics are still beautiful, and the freedom you get in the game is insane. I love how you can switch between Michael, Franklin, and Trevor, and every mission feels exciting instead of repetitive.

But the part that made me fall completely in love with the game is LSPDFR. It literally turns GTA V into a police simulator. You get to pull over cars, respond to robberies, chase criminals, and use actual police equipment. Sometimes it feels so real that I forget I‚Äôm playing GTA. For me, LSPDFR makes the game feel like two games in one‚Äîstory mode + a fully different experience as a cop.

Even after so many years, I still keep coming back to GTA V because there‚Äôs always something new to do. Mods, missions, exploring, just messing around‚Ä¶ it never gets boring. If you love open-world games or want to try something unique like LSPDFR, GTA V is 100% worth playing.
Can't believe Rockstar games had to fund the end of the world with AI and ID identification laws, so they didn't have to make GTA6.

GTA V offers a huge open world with an exciting story and three memorable characters. The gameplay is smooth and full of variety, from driving to action-packed missions. GTA Online adds even more fun with constant updates, new activities, and the freedom to play with friends. Overall, it‚Äôs a great package that still feels fresh and enjoyable today.

For an unmodded, vanilla experience, I highly suggest playing the Enhanced version as it has some graphical improvements and performance fixes (shorter load times, slightly less space)

To mod the game, simply disable Battleye, then install ScriptHook V and OpenIV. Head over to GTA5-Mods or Nexus, and download whatever mods catch your eye. My personal favorites is Rebalanced Dispatch Enhanced (overhauls wanted system), Natural Vision Enhanced (specifically high weapon decals & sounds) Forests of San Andreas and Euphoria Ragdoll Overhaul.

Story mode is amazing. You get to play as three protags in a huge map, with the ability to do anything you want. As somebody who plays on a semi good pc, legacy is amazing. It still looks great, and it runs amazing.

üéÆ Grand Theft Auto V Legacy ‚Äì Gameplay Review
üåü Strengths
- Immersive Story Mode: The campaign with Michael, Franklin, and Trevor is still one of the most engaging in gaming. Missions blend cinematic storytelling with action-packed gameplay, keeping you hooked from start to finish.
- Variety of Activities: Beyond the main missions, players can dive into side quests, sports, races, and random encounters. This variety makes Los Santos feel alive and gives you plenty to do even after the story ends.
- Dynamic Open World: The city reacts to your actions ‚Äî from police chases to NPC interactions ‚Äî creating a sense of realism and unpredictability.
- Heist System: Planning and executing heists remains a standout feature, offering multiple approaches and rewarding replayability.
- Driving & Shooting Mechanics: Vehicles handle smoothly, and gunplay feels responsive, making both combat and exploration satisfying.

‚ö†Ô∏è Weaknesses
- Outdated Visuals: Compared to modern titles, textures and lighting in Legacy look dated, especially in crowded areas.
- AI Limitations: NPCs can feel repetitive in behavior, and enemy AI sometimes lacks challenge.
- Online Grind: GTA Online (in the Legacy version) often requires excessive grinding to unlock content, which can frustrate players who prefer faster progression.
- Performance Quirks: On newer systems, occasional stutters or compatibility issues remind you this is an older build.

Even with lackluster updates (except Cayo Perico) for a decade, it is still a better experience than any other modern game.

For 10 years, I couldn't even believe that the first time I went through this, I was still very young, and then everything seemed completely different to me. Now that I'm an adult, everything has become much better. I started to understand the jokes, the action, the director's moments, the twist and the denouement, and how cruel and cool it really is, but at the same time I noticed quite a few bad ones.

51 hours exploring Los Santos and I've spent most of it driving cars off cliffs, evading the cops, and wondering why Trevor is the way he is.

GTA V is basically three games in one: a sprawling single-player story with three distinct protagonists, an absolute time-sink of an online mode, and a physics playground where you see just how much chaos you can cause before the game gives up.

The story mode is genuinely well-written, with Michael, Franklin, and Trevor making for one of gaming's most dysfunctional crews. The heist missions are particularly satisfying, and switching between characters mid-mission never gets old.

Los Santos itself is a stunningly detailed recreation of satirical Los Angeles. Every corner has something to discover, every radio station is perfectly curated, and the attention to detail is absurd. I've spent entire sessions just driving around and listening to the radio.

The "Legacy" edition on Steam is essentially the single-player experience, which is honestly the best part of the package. No shark cards, no grinding, just pure chaotic sandbox fun.

With only 11 of 77 achievements, I clearly have more mayhem to cause. If you haven't played this yet, honestly, where have you been? It's been out since 2013, bud.

Overall Score: 7.6/10
Story: 8/10 For a generic environment and a repetitive formula for this type of game. They done a great job making characters rememberable and to have good personalities. 
Gameplay: 8/10 Your standard GTA mechanics, and gameplay, with a large variety of features and objectives to do. 
Graphics: 7/10 For an older game,  the graphics are pretty good. 
Solo VS Online: 10/10 Trying to be strict, but both the story mode and the online are pretty flawless and still played today.
Achievements: 5/10 A lot of the achievements are fun and easy to get by just playing the game. Then you have the super repetitive go round the map for collectibles, and then the online achievements...

GTA Online is the kind of game where you jump in thinking ‚ÄúI‚Äôll do a quick mission‚Äù and three hours later you‚Äôre still running from some guy on an Oppressor who blew up your car for no reason. But that‚Äôs the fun part: it‚Äôs total chaos, but fun chaos.
You can do anything: heists, races, trolling people, buying insanely expensive cars you don‚Äôt even need, and every session something stupid and hilarious happens.

For me, it‚Äôs still one of the most fun online games ever. It‚Äôs not perfect, it makes you mad sometimes, but you keep coming back because no other game gives you this level of insanity.

Now that there is an enhanced version, this is no longer the case. I had over 2000 hours played and saw some changes in the game.

It was fun before modders took control. After that, the game became chaotic and insecure. Still, I had some of my best GTA moments during the modder rampages, and I wish they would add some of the content modders created into the game.

One modder took me in a jet and spawned 100 jets around us to attack us during a storm‚Äîchaotic but super awesome.

Another time, they copied my character 50 times and started a fistfight. There were all kinds of strange, game-breaking things, but it was fun. It was rare to see fun/happy/good modder tho. It was rare to see fun/happy/good modder tho. And let's not forget about raining money. ü§ë

But everything has to end at some point. The game is calmer now. It's better that players don't have so much power.

Grand Theft Auto V (GTA V) is an open-world action-adventure game developed by Rockstar North and published by Rockstar Games. Set in the fictional state of San Andreas, the game follows the intertwined stories of three protagonists‚ÄîMichael De Santa, a retired bank robber living a troubled suburban life; Franklin Clinton, a young hustler seeking opportunity; and Trevor Philips, a volatile criminal with a chaotic past. Players can freely switch between the characters during gameplay, each offering unique skills and perspectives.

The game features a vast, detailed open world inspired by Southern California, including the sprawling city of Los Angeles (reimagined as Los Santos), desert hinterlands, mountains, and coastal areas. GTA V combines third-person shooting, driving, stealth, and role-playing elements, allowing players to complete missions, explore the environment, and engage in numerous side activities such as skydiving, stock trading, and competitive multiplayer.

Its online component, Grand Theft Auto Online, offers a persistent world where players can team up or compete in heists, races, deathmatches, and custom game modes, continually expanded with new content since its 2013 launch. Known for its sharp satire, cinematic storytelling, and technical polish, GTA V is one of the best-selling and most influential video games of all time.

negative.review:
Rockstar Games has decided to follow the same path as EA Games and discriminate consumers by their preference in operating systems, accusing them as hackers/cheaters to justify enforcing rootkit Anti-Cheat software. However, they have taken it a step further to now block Single Player and instead of telling users that you can no longer play the game, it will crash your entire computer for absolutely zero reason. Take that what you will, but I see that as an unnecessary malicious attack towards paying customers who bought this game for the sole purpose of just playing the damn game.

I will no longer support Rockstar Games for the foreseeable future. I must advice others to take action against them, as well as demanding a full refund.

Bought gta v on this account in 2015 and changed my email provider last year. They wont help me fix the issue because they cant verify I bought the game WHEN ITS IN MY STEAM LIBRARY albeit I have screenshots from this account, the recipe of the game, the epic account where I have RDR 2 and also the email backups from the email account I do not have access anymore and which I want to replace. Their customer support is a joke. They don't even read what you are writing in the ticket or look at the screenshots you send them. They just answer with pregenerated emails which are not even related to my issue at all and mark the ticket as solved and close it without even communicating with me or actually solving the issue. If you open another ticket so your issue have a chance to actually being solved, they just close your tickets without any response. I don't think that I will buy another rockstar game because of this crappy service. It feels like they are stealing my games, because I don't see a reason why all of my backuped emails from 2014, when I created the account, until last year, recipes of multiple buys, and screenshots from my steam and epic account are not enough to validate me as the owner of those games and this rockstar account. I can't even unlink my steam account to link it to a new rockstar account. They can just hold my steam account hostage without me being able to use it at all. In my view they are criminals for doing this practice.

I‚Äôm experiencing a problem when trying to launch GTA V through Steam. Every time I start the game, the Rockstar Launcher opens and shows a message saying that the Activation Code is already in use, even though the game was purchased officially through Steam.

Here is what happens:
 ‚Ä¢ I launch the game from Steam
 ‚Ä¢ The Rockstar Launcher opens
 ‚Ä¢ It asks me to enter an activation code
 ‚Ä¢ After entering the code, it shows the message:
‚ÄúRockstar Activation Code already in use‚Äù
 ‚Ä¢ This means the code is already linked to a different Rockstar Social Club account, not the one I‚Äôm currently logged into

Since the Steam version of GTA V does not require entering a code manually, this error happens because the game is linked to another Rockstar account, or the launcher is signing me into the wrong account.

I need assistance with:
 ‚Ä¢ Identifying which Rockstar account my Steam copy of GTA V is linked to
 ‚Ä¢ Fixing the link between my Steam account and the correct Rockstar account
 ‚Ä¢ Or resolving the activation window that keeps appearing incorrectly

I only played single player. I found this game boring and repetative compared to GTA 4. I found jumping between 3 different characters annoying and often had to switch between them all many times to discover which character was required to progress the story line. This game just felt like a chore and I didn't find the story interesting at all. Driving across the map for 10 minutes to do a 5 minute objective gets old real fast. While I loved GTA, GTA2 and GTA 4 ( I didnt play the other ones) I don't think I have the patience to spend hours exploring a map doing repetative quests and side quests. I will probably pass on GTA6 now.

Good game but I cant play it anymore. I would love to try or re-live the others too but rocktstar ruined the whole experience with the steam-link that only they can remove. I went down a rabit hole reading about this problem online. At least hundreds but more then likely thousands of players who have paid their money via steam for the games needing the Rockstar laucher cant play it because Rockstar like to be in control of linking and unlinking steam accounts. 

For example: You didnt play a rockstar game you bought years ago for a while now and you forgot the login or mail to rockstar launcher. Congratiulations! All your Rockstar games on your steam account are worthless now! Even the ones you buy after it. Can you unlink? Yes you can, but they ask the most ridiculous information which almost nobody has laying around anymore. Who does remember the exact moment and date the laucher was linked to the steam account...?  They ask a lot. People who can actually collect the information that is asked to unlink a steam profile often have to wait weeks or months to get a final reaction from Rockstar. I sended a mail 3 times and only got a response once after about 5 weeks. 

So if you buy a Rockstar game and find yourself in this situation with not being able to link an new rockstar launcher account to your existing steamaccount, just return the game. 

For those who are still brave enough and want Rockstar to unlink, you can get a support ticket for this on their website. Steam cant do anything about this, its all a rockstar problem. You could also keep making steam accounts to link to new launchers and keep buying the same games again and again. It seems like Rockstar want you to do that xD
Once the "funny" shock value goes away you see that the story and overall gameplay is pretty poor.

LIke everyone else, I grew up playing Grand Theft Auto.

I do love them but I lost access to my old email that was unfortunately used for my Rockstar Games account and now I cannot boot this or any other Rockstar game using their 3rd party launcher (Red Dead, GTA IV, likely GTA VI).

Rockstar support seems to be a team of bots, sending me the exact same copy-pasted message with a different agent in the signature. Despite attaching proof, they just automatically close my ticket and I cannot reply, saying "We investigated" and now I can't access games I've spent hundreds of dollars on, and saves I've spend hundreds of hours on. They can't just unlink my Steam account from my Rockstar Games account, instead I can never play something made by them again as long as it uses their 3rd party launcher.

This game had fun in it but fivem servers are the only acceptable way to play it after they ran it into the ground. The heists are boring and the freeroam pvp, which used to just involve sniper duels until someone left the session because of awful spawns, is now just rocket bike duels until someone leaves the session. I would bring up the insane amount of hackers, as they are a staple of any Rockstar game, but the experience varies with them. You could end up fistfighting 100 clones of yourself or having a guy shoot cash out of a minigun at you. I'm sure the story was ok, but I never played it.

The game is fun but the fact that you struggle to join friends or online is annoying as hell even after trying every single "fix" Rockstar gives you. It is not worth the price for this much of a hassel. Every time you try to play it is 3/4 hours of struggling to join a friend or online in general.
